Physiological/Pathological: Primarily physiological demonstration of cardiorenal crosstalk; can introduce injury or toxins to simulate pathology
Cell Source: hiPSC-derived cardiomyocytes & renal organoids; no immune cells by default
Multiple Cell Types: Yes (each organoid contains multiple cell types intrinsic to heart or kidney differentiation)
Stromal Cells: Present within organoids (cardiac fibroblasts, renal interstitial cells) but not explicitly engineered
Tissue-resident Immune: No (not standard); could be added if needed
Circulating Immune: No; system does not typically flow immune cells, though feasible in principle
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Yes – heart and kidney organoids connected by fluid flow for multi-organ interaction
Extracellular Matrix: Organoids typically embedded in or formed with Matrigel/self-ECM
3D Scaffold: Yes; both heart and kidney are 3D organoids
Notable Features: Perfusion-based multi-organ co-culture, minimal shear stress, demonstration of organ-specific function (beating heart tissue, albumin uptake in kidney), ~72h stable co-culture
Plate/Format (Throughput): Custom microfluidic chip, single multi-organ circuit, low throughput
Max Culture Duration: Demonstrated up to 3 days; potentially extendable with advanced fluidics
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes (observe beating in cardiac organoid, kidney function via labeled markers)
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes (perfusate sampling for biomarkers, if design allows output ports)
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Potentially at endpoint (remove organoids for histology/molecular assays)
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes (fix organoids post-experiment for IHC, confocal, etc.)
Readouts - MEA: No integrated MEA; arrhythmic function assessed visually/metabolically if needed
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: Not in this demo; future designs may integrate sensors
Dead Volume: Low due to microfluidic design and gentle pump system
Perfused: Yes (continuous flow linking heart & kidney chambers)
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Possible via Demcon’s fluidic control (changing flow/drug addition dynamically)
model_availability: Engineering demonstration; offered via custom development or collaborative service (not a standard off-the-shelf kit)
